quiz.question: Can a static interface method be marked final?
Buffered reader syntax is while(reader.readline()!=null). What will happen?
quiz.answer: It will print null if there are even number of lines

quiz.question: An int variable is assigned to an executeQuery command. What will be the output?
public functional interface chew {} // what will be the output
quiz.answer: Does not compile. There is no "functional" modifier in Java.

quiz.question: BasicFileAttributeView.setTimes(null, null, null); // what will be the output ?
quiz.answer: It will leave the BasicFileAttributes date and time values unchanged.

quiz.question: service.submit(()-> selectWinner(i)); // What is wrong with this code ?
quiz.answer: submit uses a callable or runnable in the form of a lambda and will not take any parameters

quiz.question: given a list of int values without using  generics and an enhanced for loop for(Number num :  list) System.out.print(num) what will be the output ?
quiz.answer: It will not compile. To make it compile replace Number with Object.

quiz.question: Which Java version was NIO released in ?
NIO API was intended as a replacement for ....
NIO.2 API is actually a replacement for
Which interface is the primary entry point for working with the NIO.2 API?
_______________ is a is a special file within an operating system that serves as a reference or pointer to another file or directory.
you can create an instance of a Path interface using a static method available in the ________factory class
Why is Path an interface and not a class ?
quiz.answer: The reason why Path is an interface and not a class is that creating a file or directory is considered a file systemâ€“dependent task in NIO.2.

quiz.question: _______ base file systems are case sensitive, while ______-based file systems are not
java.nio.file.Files  class's primary purpose is to operate on instances of______objects
Which classes are often composed primarily of static methods that operate on a particular class.?
Helper classes are focused on ________________, whereas factory classes are focused primarily on __________.
quiz.answer: manipulating or creating new objects from existing instances, object creation
